course.subject: ISOM
course.name: Global Supply Chain Management
course.description: Single node inventory control, supply chain network, demand management, manufacturing and replenishment in supply chains, information and coordination in supply chains, product variety management.
course.prerequisites: ISOM 2700 AND ISOM 3710

reviews.author: Guess who am I
reviews.title: Xuan Wang is the best prof I have ever met in HKUST :)
reviews.comment_content:
Intro to Supply Chain Management (SCM)
SCM Drivers and Metrics
Designing Distribution Networks and Applications to Omnichannel Retailing
Network Design Optimization
Inventory Management
Risk Pooling Strategies to Reduce and Hedge Uncertainty
Global Supply Chain Network
Sourcing Decisions in a Supply Chain
Sales and Operations Planning in a Supply Chain
Transportation in a Supply Chain
Pricing and Revenue Management in Supply Chains
Supply Chain Finance
reviews.comment_teaching:
Excellent teaching, PPT and teaching is very clear
Lecture video will be uploaded after each class
reviews.comment_grading:
Class participation 5%
In-Class quizzes (3) and simulation game (2) 25%
Mid term 25% (--> 30%)
Group project 15%
Final exam 30% (--> 25%)

Quiz 1: mean 12/15 me 11/15
Quiz 2: mean 11.4/15 me 15/15
Quiz 3: cancelled
Mid term: mean 80.2/100 me 83.5/100
Final: mean 81.1/100 me 94/100
Group project: mark not released

Final Grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
3 in class quizzes
2 simulation game
1 mid term (MC and some calculation problems)
1 final exam (MC and short questions)
1 group project (3-4 people in a group), including 4 page report and 20 mins presentation

reviews.author: Hayoha
reviews.title: SUPER GOOD PROFESSOR
reviews.comment_content:
Mainly explained the supply chain concepts, problems, solutions with cases. Also, some formulas will be used for analysis.
Cases:
1. Donner Manufacturing Company
2. Steel Works, Inc.
3. Lamson Corporation (R)
4. Toy World, Inc.
5. Sport Obermeyer, Ltd.
6. HP Deskjet Printer Supply Chain
7. Barilla SpA (A-D)
8. Seven-Eleven Japan Co
9. SF Express: From Delivery to E-Commerce
10. Supply Chain Hubs in Global Humanitarian Logistics
11. Mission Impossible? Yummy77 Delivers Groceries within the Hour
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Cheung is super good, he even open 4 sessions just to have small classes, for better teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
In-class Participation 1.5% 3 points
On-line Quiz 3.5% 7 points
Simulation Game 10% 20 points
Final project 15% 30 points
Quiz 30% 60 points
Final exam 40% 80 points
Total 100% 200 points

In-class participation is easy to get (maybe because my session only has 10 students in total), professor's questions are not difficult to answer, he does not care if you are correct or not, just show your participation. However, for the class which has many students (like 30), then you may need to try harder.

For quizzes, Professor gave around 10 quizzes and only count the 9 of them as the first one is still within add-drop period, 2 questions per quiz, so total you have 18 questions, you only need to get 14 questions correct to get full score (1 question correct then 0.5 point).

Simulation Game, the mean is high (18.23/20), but your group will have 4 trials, just try to get the best result.

Final Project, you can report the freerider if there is any. Mean: 25.87/30
Median: 26 High: 28
Upper Quartile: 26 Low: 24
Lower Quartile: 25

Midterm: mean--> 46.17/60
Median: 45 High: 60
Upper Quartile: 50 Low: 32
Lower Quartile: 42

Final: mean--> 59.3/80
Median: 62 High: 75
Upper Quartile: 67 Low: 28
Lower Quartile: 54.75
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload for a 4 credits course.
Both final and midterm are open book open notes, Professor even allow you to use laptop (not searching Google, just read the PPT/ notes from it)

F2f lectures are once per week while also have weekly online videos need to watch (blended learning mode), this was the practice even before COVI-19, online videos are for your preparement of weekly quizzes. Only 2 MC questions per quiz.
The simulation game could be time consuming, as you need to check and try for the best strategy. To run it once, my group used around 3-4 hours, as discussions involved. It will be held near to your final project presentation, so better finished your PPT and everything earlier before your Simulation Game.

reviews.author: Chris_Donkor
reviews.comment_content:
Lots of concept and equations to remember.
Kind of a deeper dive for ISOM 2700.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Absolutely love hear teaching!
So detailed and step by step crack down on the equation and concept.

Even if you have to ask her questions, she loves to answer them.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class participation 5%
Online games 10%
Individual assignments 10%
Midterm exam 30%
Group project 15%
Final exam 30%


Class Participation: As long as you have sit in the class and answer some question, it should be fine. (Most important is professor recognize you)_

Online Game: Doesn't matter if you win or loose. Just remember to fill in the attendee sheet on that day.

Individual assignments; Pretty straightforward. Methods can be found on the lecture slide and not too difficult if pay attention in class. Professor will also answer to your questions. Just ask.

Midterm exam and Exam: A big chart of MC with one (mid-term) to two (final exam) long question. Long Question is similar to Individual Assignment, so it won't be difficult if you have revised the assignment beforehand.

Group project:
3 Types of topics:

1) A company that excels in its supply chain
management or performs not well in supply chain
management.

• Analyze its supply chain strategies and the reason why it performs well or badly.

• Give recommendations to the company for further
improvement.

**half page repost need to be handed in for review

2) Choose a key technology and analyze its impact on current supply chains.

• Explore other potential uses of this technology in supply chain management.

• Conjecture and give a forward prediction of the future of supply chain if this high-tech innovation is further
advanced and applied.

3) Consider an existing supply chain which has a social impact, such as the supply chain of organ donation, organic food, or blood donation.

• Analyze the current status of this supply chain and identify issues and risks associated with this supply chain.

• Give recommendations on how to improve this supply chain.
reviews.comment_workload: Work Load not too heavy, just timing a  bit tight for assignment. Coz it has been released before professor has taught. So only 1-1.5 week to complete the assignment.

reviews.author: thanos
reviews.title: Nice professor & Little workload for 4 credits
reviews.comment_content:
First few weeks are some basic review about ISOM 2700 contents
Continuous review, periodic review model with different safety stock and service level. Almost all calculation questions are based on these topic

After mid term would be case studies on supply chain management.
Examples include Zara, HP, 7-11 and SF express.
Final questions require better understanding of concepts (risk pooling, postponement,different types of capacity......) and using these in different hypothetical scenarios to solve the cases.

Simulation game is very interesting, need to use all concepts learnt to control the whole supply chain process (from forecast to production capacity allocation)
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Cheung is very nice, delivering interesting cases in each lecture, clear ppt which illustrates the concepts neatly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading
Online quizzes: full marks (2MCs per quiz each week after watching some videos)
Mid term: 58/60, mean: 44
Final: 77/80, mean: 62
Project: 28/30, mean: 27
Simulation game: 20/20, mean: 18
Participation: full marks
Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload
One 1.5 hour lecture per week
3-5 online lecture video per week (each about 10 mins)
Quiz with 2 MCs only about the online videos per week
Simulation Game takes around a day with groupmates
A standard business course project (about 20 ppt slide and present for 15 mins, 4 people team) don't worry about the design
Content is the only thing that matters

I can't agree more on the comment below
"the workload is lighter than those 2 cred mgmt course" ^^

Perhaps it's a zoom semester so no stress from presentation
It is also easy to get the attendance score as long as you participate (say sth in chat)

reviews.author: 垃圾科大
reviews.comment_content: can refer to the syllabus attached :)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ki Ling is a nice professor, clear teaching and willing to answer students questions.

Angel is also a very responsive TA, she replies email promptly. Her tutorials are very useful for the topics with calculation.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good Grading
Online quizzes: full marks (nearly everyone gets full marks)
Mid term: 48/60, mean: 44
Final: 76/80, mean: 62
Project: 29/30, mean: 27
Simulation game: 19/20, mean: 18

Final grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
Light for a 4 cred courses.
The project and simulation game can be done quickly as long as you have reliable group mates.
I think the workload is even less than those rubbish 2 cred mgmt course ^^

reviews.author: Gerry
reviews.comment_content:
Intro to Supply Chain Management (SCM)
SCM Drivers and Metrics
CASE: 7-11
Designing Distribution Networks
Network Design Optimization
Inventory Management
Risk Pooling Strategies
CASE: Zara
Global Supply Chain Network
Sourcing Decisions in a Supply Chain
Sales and Operations Planning in an SC

reviews.comment_teaching:
Very clear teaching. Concepts broken down very well, easy to understand. Patient, good delivery.

Wordings, explanations, math workings in PPT, reading materials, hw examples are also straightforward and very close to exam Qs.
reviews.comment_grading:
Excellent grading.
Class participation: 5%
Online games: 10% (just make sure you attend classes that have sim. games)
Two HWs: 10% (not too difficult)
Midterm exam: 30% (MCQ)
Group project: 15%
Final exam:30% (MCQ)

MT Full, Grp Project and Final only slightly above mean. A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Medium workload, but very worth it for the easy A. 3 credit workload despite being 4 credits. Lenient grading all round.

2 HWs, can finish in a couple hours if you pay attention in class.
Group project not too difficult either. 4 page report, 10-15 minute presentation on a firm's supply chain strategy. Groupmates weren't the most engaged. Thought would only get average or slightly below for group project, but ended up being good grading.

reviews.author: Ferrari
reviews.title: Good grade course
reviews.comment_content:
Half of the content is the same as ISOM2700.
Most of the content is about six drivers in the supply chain: facilities, inventory, transportation, information, sourcing and pricing. We also learnt some case study: 7-eleven, Zara and Sport Obermeyer Ltd.
The whole content of this course is quite interesting. During the whole semester, we have played three simulation games: Beer game, Lamson corporation and Global supply chain management simulation game.
reviews.comment_teaching: Wang Xuan is the best professor that I have ever met in HKUST. She is patient and willing to answer questions related to supply chain management from students although those questions are outside course content. There is an office hour every week at Zoom. Professor would stay in the Zoom meeting during the whole office hour even though no one shows up.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair and excellent grading.
Class participation: 5%
Online games: 10% (you can get full mark as long as you attend the class)
Two individual assignments:10% (not too difficult)
Midterm exam:30% (all mc questions)
Group project: 15%
Final exam:30% (all mc questions)
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is medium.
Two exams are easy. Non-cumulative. Just need to attend every class and review all lecture notes before exams then you will get a good mark.
Group project: not difficult, 3-5 students in one group, write a half-page write-up before midterm, write a group project report before final (maximum 4 pages), group presentation (10-15 minutes per group)

reviews.author: C-range eater
reviews.title: Nice professor, excellent teaching and good grade!
reviews.comment_content:
For course content, please refer to the syllabus attached.
Generally speaking, the course is about the six drivers (i.e. Inventory, Facility, Transportation, Information, Pricing, Sourcing) affecting the supply chain efficiency and responsiveness, also their tradeoffs. A couple of cases and examples are introduced to facilitate students' understandings on the operations level of different drivers (e.g. Zara, 7-11). Also, you will have chances to implement what you have learnt in 3 different simulation games. You will find it interesting since you are not just learning concepts/textbook facts, you can also try to apply them and figure out the positive/negative consequences. The applications of Math involved in this course are quite simple. All of the calculations are based on newsvendor model and EOQ model (as mentioned in ISOM2700). No worries if you are weak in Math.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Wang is excellent in teaching. She explained everything in a very detailed and organized way. The lecture time is managed very well and nothing would be missed during lectures. You will surely understand all the concepts if you attended all the lectures with concentration.
reviews.comment_grading:
Excellent grading, your effort will surely pay off in this course (unlike many other courses in UST).

Grading Scheme and Distribution:
Online simulation games [10%]: 10/10 (Mean: NA)
Assignment 1 [5%]: 5/5 (Mean: NA)
Assignment 2 [5%]: 4.85/5 (Mean: 4.28/5)
Group Project [15%]: 14/15 (Mean: 13.6/15)
Midterm Exam [30%]: 27/30 (Mean: 24.3/30, SD: 3.38)
Final Exam [30%]: 30/30 (Mean: 25.59/30, SD: 2.51)
Participation [5%]: Unknown*
*Remarks: I have attended most of the lectures (probably missing 2 to 3 lectures?), but I didn't ask or answer any questions in class...
Final Grade: A+

The online games are participation-based, so try to obtain all these easy credits. The assignments are not difficult, tutorials will help a lot if you encounter some challenging questions in assignments. For midterm and final exams, you are provided with sufficient time, so try to be as careful as possible to obtain a good score. The questions will not trick you with the measuring units, but the questions may challenge/trick you with the concepts! Also, I advise you to pay attention in class since some of the easy credits in exams will be from the videos professor played / examples or cases that professor introduced. Overall, the exam is quite easy and the mean is reasonably high.
reviews.comment_workload: I would say it is a 4-credit course with a 3-credit workload. There are only two tutorials throughout the whole semester. The assignments are quite simple in general, with one or two challenging questions. The project is not difficult to handle, commence the project one week in advance would be pretty fine.

reviews.author: hys爬
reviews.comment_content: Literally are cases in operation management world like zara, dell, etc. Pretty easy to get the points if you pay enough attention to the cases and some simple quantitative knowledge in isom2700.
reviews.comment_teaching: Blended learning. Some parts are not delivered so clearly but fine  after all.
reviews.comment_grading: Got high in midterm and final so I got A+ without questions but i think the grading should be fine.
reviews.comment_workload: Almost can say 0 wl as it is a 4 credit course. No homework, just a small amount of weekly quizzes which are super easy. There is a project and a game finished in groups, may resulting in some wl in group discussion.

reviews.author: channg
reviews.title: Good course, Good professor, Good grade
reviews.comment_content:
Useful materials
Interesting simulation games
Content is not too difficult as long as you pay attention in class

"A supply chain is comprised of all the parties involved in fulfilling a customer request. The integrated management of this network is a critical determinant of success in today’s competitive environment. Companies such as Apple, Toyota, Dell, Procter & Gamble, and Amazon are proof that excellence in supply chain management is a must for financial strength and industry leadership.
With increasing competition around the globe, supply chain management is both a challenge and an opportunity for companies. Therefore, a strong understanding of supply chain management concepts and the ability to recommend improvements should be in the toolbox of all managers. The objective of this course is to introduce you to the key concepts and techniques that will allow you to analyze, manage and improve supply chain processes for different industries and markets. At completion of this course, you will have the skills to assess supply chain performance and make recommendations to increase supply chain competitiveness."
reviews.comment_teaching: Super clear and friendly professor(and she replies to email quickly)
reviews.comment_grading:
Super good, probably because of online teaching.
As long as you get above mean for everything, you should secure at least B range.

HW1: 80+/100
HW2: 90+/100
Midterm: above mean
Final: mean +1SD
Online games: full mark
Group project: mean

Letter grade: A range
reviews.comment_workload:
1 group project and presentation
2 exams
2 homeworks
several online games(free credits)
some participation points

Just follow the lectures, review the content regularly, and no need to read the textbook(by the way participation points count so make sure you talk in class)
